page.title: 05East and West Hauxwell 1985
page.content: There's a quiet old_world atmosphere about the 15 unspoilt stone houses and cottages which line the steep Bank in {East Hauxwell. }All of them, including three farms,belong to Hauxwell Estate, presently the property of Mr.R.Dalton, a diplomat who resides at the Hall. Now only one villager is employed on the estate.{Counting Ayrlow Banks and {West Hauxwell 42 adults live here.}12 are retired, 8 are housewives, 6 farm and the rest commute to professional or other jobs. The{13 school children bus into Wensleydale,go to Richmond,or attend boarding school. East Hauxwell {school was closed in 1962.}It's a pity to see it and the Reading Room disused and in need of repair. Apart from the annual Parish Council meeting village events are rare, but in October an{oak tree will be ceremonially planted in memory of the late Maj.General Dalton.
